(45) 248.Wh April, 1945.WAR CABINET.COMMITTEE ON REPARATIONS.Note by the Prime Minister.WHEN this matter was discussed at the War Cabinet on the 22nd March(W.M. (45) 35th Conclusions) I said I would consider how it should be dealt within future.2. I have reached the conclusion that a Ministerial Committee should beset up composed as follows : Chancellor of the Exchequer (Chairman).Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.Minister of Labour and National Service.President of the Board of Trade.Minister of Supply.Minister of Food.Paymaster-General.3. The first task of this Committee will be to prepare and submit to theWar Cabinet draft instructions to our representatives on the forthcomingReparation Conference in Moscow.4. The Committee will have the assistance of a committee of officials of theDepartments principally concerned.W. S. .C10, Downing Street, S.W. 1,Uth April, 1945.
